properties.name: Porcos Porchetteria
properties.description: good pastries; perfect for cancelling out a workout in the Pilates studio across the road.

properties.name: Chick's
properties.description: A bar with decent yuppie food. Now that people are moving into the ~yuppie hives~ luxury condos that are sprouting on Washington st, they're liable to be crowded.

properties.name: The Sidecar Bar & Grille
properties.description: If you want to ease someone into having a cheesesteak, their cheesesteak pizza is a good start.

properties.name: Ants Pants Cafe
properties.description:
Go for the homefries, stay for the bottomless coffee. Be prepared to pay with cash or venmo. 

THIS IS MY FAVORITE --Emma

properties.name: Sabrina's Cafe - South Street
properties.description: An Experience. It can get pretty crowded.  Pretty good home fries but doesn't match Ants Pants.

properties.name: Carbon Copy
properties.description: I heard a story about a pizza place that was a money laundering front for the mob that was so successful that the mob abandoned crime to focus on their more lucrative pie business. This place is like that: Carbon Copy is part brewery, part pizza place in an old firehouse; in my opinion, you go for the pizza.  Recommend trying the samosa pizza.

properties.name: Clarkville
properties.description: Their pizza and beer are good, but the real attraction is the people who brought a kitten on a leash and let them explore. This happened once, but it's still worth mentioning.

properties.name: Cedar Park Cafe
properties.description: The archetype of a greasy-spoon diner. Solid grits.

properties.name: Vietnam Café
properties.description:
Very tasty Asian fusion cuisine specializing in Vietnamese dishes. They have a good space for larger groups. 
Not to be confused with Vientiane Café.

properties.name: Satellite Cafe
properties.description: Crunchy-granola hole-in-the-wall. Their cookies are surprisingly good.  Coffee is just okay though.  BUT only cafe open until 5 PM.

properties.name: Spinning Chairs Barber Shop
properties.description: I started going here when we moved to West Philly. It's a full-on spa treatment: shampoo, a shave, skincare, and enough steam-aromatherapy to be considered waterboarding. The haircut's good, too.

properties.name: Movement Callowhill
properties.description: A mid-size climbing gym. I'd put it on par with some of the mid-size Central Rock Gym locations.

properties.name: Mood Cafe
properties.description:
College-price indian food. The very nice proprietor gave us separate containers of spicy and non-spicy sauce when he heard we always get mild sauce when we share.
The mango lassi is 10/10 and extremely large.

properties.name: West Philadelphia YMCA
properties.description: YOUNG MAN

properties.name: Drip Vietnamese Cafe
properties.description: Good Vietnamese coffee and banh mi

properties.name: Fu-Wah Mini Market
properties.description: Killer banh mi. There's usually a line; be prepared to pay cash.  Also strangely the only local shop we can find bulgar wheat.

properties.name: Cinemark University City Penn 6
properties.description: In the summer, they have half-price tickets on Tuesdays. Consider smuggling in snacks, because their popcorn isn't quite as good as Costco's off-the-shelf movie popcorn while being 1000x the price.

properties.name: VIX Emporium
properties.description: A shop that specializes in local artists' work. They have the best greeting cards!

properties.name: The Last Word Bookshop
properties.description: They have a friendly cat (Millie). They also happen to sell used books.

properties.name: House of Our Own Books
properties.description: A used book store where the books take up every surface of what used to be a house. No cat.

properties.name: Cleo Bagels
properties.description: Fresh bagels made on-site. They have a weekday deal called "the Trolley Bialy" on a coffee + bialy combo. It's good (especially the garlic-zataar bialy) but make sure to grab napkins, since they typically add a ton of butter to the bialy. Also solid coffee choice.

properties.name: Clark Park Farmers' Market
properties.description: The usual farmers' market experience, but still fun!

properties.name: TACOTACOMEXICANO
properties.description: Exactly what it sounds like.

properties.name: Bottle Shop at Local 44
properties.description: Exactly what it sounds like: a place to buy bottles of beer/wine. They've got a good selection.

properties.name: St. Francis De Sales Catholic Church
properties.description:
It has an attractive dome, but the church's wikipedia page has the inside story:

> The Guastavino dome has leaked for the entire life of the church. All of the tiles on the entire dome were replaced in the 1950s by then-pastor Bishop Joseph McShea in an unsuccessful attempt to stop the leaking. It was suggested that the parish go with copper sheathing, but the bishop was reluctant to make such a drastic change.[5] Partners for Sacred Places, a Philadelphia-area interfaith group that works to support the preservation of churches and other houses of worship, is currently working with the parish to restore the dome, the stained-glass windows, and the doors.
>
> --https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St._Francis_de_Sales_Roman_Catholic_Church_(Philadelphia)

properties.name: Wissahickon Valley Park
properties.description: A great trail network (in all senses of the word "great")

properties.name: PAPERtrail Bike Cafe
properties.description: One of three coffee shops for mountain bikers hidden in the Wissahickon trail network. Good espresso, but no AC.

properties.name: Parkway Central Library
properties.description: They also have cooking classes and an art exhibit.

properties.name: Book Corner
properties.description: Where the Philadelphia Free Library sells books and DVDs they want to get rid of. They have a very old, very friendly cat (Chaucer).

properties.name: Vientiane Café
properties.description:
Very good Lao-Thai food in an intimate space.
Not to be confused with Vietnam Café.

properties.name: Watutsi Pub
properties.description: A bit of an open-air dive bar. They do serve the Citywide, though: a special consisting of a can of Pabst Blue Ribbon and a shot of something more potent.

properties.name: Juanita Kidd Stout Center for Criminal Justice
properties.description: I'm giving this place five stars 'cause I got summoned for jury duty, was given a number, missed the selection cutoff by two. A wild ride from start to finish.

properties.name: West Philly Tool Library - WPTL
properties.description: We borrowed 90% of the tools needed to get our new house in order from the WPTL! I also took a class there about basic home electrics. It's a community gem.

properties.name: Four Worlds Bakery
properties.description: The nearest local bakery. They make good bread!

properties.name: Kingsessing Library
properties.description: Our local Philadelphia library branch.  Just got a face lift and looks great.  Solid AC in the summer and open on Saturdays!

properties.name: Reading Terminal Market
properties.description: As seen in National Treasure.

properties.name: Knock Restaurant and Bar
properties.description: They make a mean espresso martini.

properties.name: Habitat for Humanity Philadelphia ReStore
properties.description: They sell everything **and** the kitchen sink here. When we were painting our new house, we saved at least $100 by using their recycled paint.

properties.name: Haven Café
properties.description: If you walk south on to the end of the Schuylkill trail, you can reward yourself with Haven Cafe's waffles.

properties.name: Hayashi Sushi
properties.description: Pretty good sushi at pretty decent prices. When we last went, someone was giving a tarot reading at the next table over.

properties.name: 30th Street Station
properties.description: One of the rare Amtrak stations that _isn't_ named Penn Station or Union Station.

properties.name: Doggie Style Pets South
properties.description: A local chain of pet-supply stores. This one usually has dogs for adoption up in the window. I'm not sure if the name is great or terrible marketing.

properties.name: Heng Feng Hand Drawn Noodles
properties.description: One of MANY awesome spots in Chinatown.

properties.name: Franklin Music Hall
properties.description: There's usually a way to see the stage and lean on something on the balcony near the bar, but the acoustics aren't great.

properties.name: Chateau Rouge
properties.description: Unlike its better-known cousin, White Castle, Chateau Rouge serves extremely good Afro-French cuisine. Excellent for special occasions.

properties.name: Breezy's Deli and Market
properties.description: Very good elongated sandwiches, or  as we call them in Philadelphia, "hoagies". This place notably adds "hoagie juice" to their "hoagies" for an extra boost.

properties.name: Milkcrate Cafe
properties.description: They also sell records.

properties.name: Philadelphia Museum of Art
properties.description: the PhArt has a collection worth visiting. It also is embroiled in a scandal where the current director kicked off a rebranding effort that the board opposed/opposes, wasting at least a million dollars. It's great entertainment!

properties.name: Kimmel Center for the Performing Arts
properties.description: Beautiful auditorium.  Philadelphia Orchestra plays here.  We heard Yuja Wang play this past year and she was phenomenal.

properties.name: Springfield Beer Distributor
properties.description: Pretty much what it sounds like: a giant warehouse full of beer that you can walk around, if you're so inclined. The prices are ok, but not amazing.

properties.name: Dock Street Brewery South
properties.description: Large seating area.  Casual dining.  Good mocktails.

properties.name: The Fresh Grocer of Grays Ferry
properties.description: Our old grocery store when we lived in Gray's Ferry.  It's a grocery store, so technically nothing special, but we just liked it.

properties.name: Thai Square Restaurant
properties.description: Great curry and outdoor seating! BYOB.

properties.name: Social House
properties.description: nice seating area.  Good Chai latte.

properties.name: Grace Tavern
properties.description: An ok beer-and-burger joint with great outdoor seating.

properties.name: Double Knot
properties.description: Good sake deal during happy hour! Also great buns. Shares a kitchen with Graffiti Bar.

properties.name: Rowhome Coffee - Pine Street
properties.description: Get the egg sandwich on a pretzel bun, it's worth it.  It's popular and a small space, so it can get crowded. You can order ahead online.

properties.name: Los Camaradas
properties.description: Great nachos.

properties.name: Bok
properties.description: Bok used to be a high school until it was bought by a public-minded millionaire who turned it into art studios and offices for small businesses. It's well worth visiting for the view from the rooftop bar, but also for its biannual open houses.

properties.name: Tuck Barre & Yoga Graduate Hospital
properties.description: If you need a good kick in the pants, take a 45 minute class holding the 4 lb weights.

properties.name: The Fillmore Philadelphia
properties.description: We went to see Josh Johnson here!

properties.name: Queen Memorial Library
properties.description: Not sure which queen. Nice books, though!

properties.name: American Sardine Bar
properties.description: Sardines are a Philly thing. This place has whole charcuterie boards of sardines and pickles, which is an experience.

properties.name: Neighborhood Books
properties.description: They have a great selection, and they're almost always running a buy-three-get-one-free special. No cat, though.

properties.name: The Woodlands
properties.description: While the woodlands is a graveyard, it also serves as a mile-long nature trail. I ran a 26.2x1-mile relay here with the West Philly Runners. _Technically_ I ran a marathon in 2:51:38.

properties.name: Philadelphia's Magic Gardens
properties.description: A local artist spent decades making mosaics out of found materials. You can find many of their installations around Philly, but this is the largest of their works by far.

properties.name: The Dandelion
properties.description: A dark-wood British pub.

properties.name: PAWS Spay/Neuter and Wellness Clinic
properties.description: Emma volunteers here.  She sends pictures of at least 1 cat every time asking Steven if we can be their new parents.

properties.name: The Book Trader
properties.description: Dr Pickle (the orange, round cat) is very friendly.

properties.name: Bookhaven
properties.description: Bookhaven has a great selection and even better cats (Emma and Jane)

properties.name: Mostly Books
properties.description: Unfortunately, we don't know the cats' names, but they are friendly.  This place has an interesting book balcony that I question the structural integrity of, but there are a lot of books.

properties.name: Bindlestiff Books
properties.description: A mix of new and used books, which helps it have an amazing selection of books. No cat.

properties.name: Toast Cafe
properties.description: FREE mimosas on Sundays. Food is pretty good too.

properties.name: Calvary Community Center
properties.description: Home to the community theater (Curio Theater Company) and with a revolving free-to-walk-in art gallery, among others.  We saw Dracula A Comedy of Terrors this Halloween.  There were 4 actors playing 8 characters; it was awesome.

properties.name: Kingsessing Ice Cream Shop
properties.description: They have affogato and a basket of lactaid pills.

properties.name: Liberty Bell
properties.description: My brother, David, and I are obsessed with the movie National Treasure, in which the Liberty Bell has a guest appearance.

properties.name: Union Transfer
properties.description: According to one of my acquaintances from West Philly Runners, this has the best acoustics of all the music venues in town.

properties.name: Molly's Books & Records
properties.description: They adopted two shop-kittens, Junior and Ace since we last visited. I guess we know what we're doing in 2026!

properties.name: Korea Taqueria - South Philly
properties.description: Contender for the best fries in Philly, IMO. Fantastic mexican-korean fusion, as well.

properties.name: Big Dog Run
properties.description: Where Philadelphia's dog high society gathers. It's a common sightseeing destination for Schuylkill trail-goers.

properties.name: Children's Hospital of Philadelphia - Main Building
properties.description: Emma works here.  Would recommend.

properties.name: Third Wheel Cheese Co.
properties.description: We didn't know this shop was in our neighborhood until after we bought our new home.  It is ESSENTIAL.

properties.name: Mariposa Food Co-op
properties.description: Our new local grocery shop.  Decent selection.

properties.name: Renata's Kitchen
properties.description: Great Mediterranean food.  Nice outdoor seating as well.  Recommend sharing some lebnah.

properties.name: Circles and Squares
properties.description: Nothing crazy special, but they make a solid pizza.

properties.name: Amada Philadelphia
properties.description: GREAT tapas.  Very affordable for a small plates place.  Best to go with a group so you can order everything.

properties.name: Schuylkill River Park
properties.description: Nice park.  Great dog watching.  Grab a pretzel sandwich at Rowhome Coffee and enjoy!

properties.name: Cafe Lift
properties.description: Bottomless coffee, chic atmosphere, and good home fries.
